title: How important is design in technology? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yes, design is important. It's not just decoration, it is a competitive advantage. Look at any competing products today. 90–98% of feature sets are same. Also, consider the fact that complexity of your app will increase with each newly added feature. But after one point of time, you will also run out of features. When a user opens your app, they don’t see your code, tech stack etc. What’s visible to them is DESIGN. What they will be interacting with is DESIGN. Design in tech is a 3-level hierarchy Product Design - Create a product that solves a problem or satisfies a desireInteraction Design - Make it easy to understand and use.Visual Design - We eat with our eyes first. Make it beautiful.It is important to take care of above said hierarchies.

See this image? I Googled ‘first computer’, so we can expect this should’ve been one of the first computers or at least what one of the first computers looked like.Would you want this in your home? Advanced and messy wires, cables and resistors everywhere? Now let’s look at this image  or this  These are consumerproducts. These are the type of computers you would like to have in your home. Sleek, simplistic, sexy. All of this is because of design. Design is the super essential part to take a technology and reshape that technology into something every person around the world would like to have. The newest emerging technologies are developed by scientists and tech geeks, these people aren’t really well known for their sense of perfection in the field of ‘good looks’. It’s up to designers who see the potential of these emerging technologies and make it beautiful. So, is design really important in technology? No. It’s essential. Without design most amazing technologies we get to enjoy today would’ve remained home kits for geeks to build without ever expanding towards the masses. With this I want to thank all designers who make our world a little more visually appealing.
